verses.verse: Give ear <S%H238><s%> to my prayer <S%H8605><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>; and hide <S%H5956><s%> not yourself from my supplication <S%H8467><s%>.
Attend <S%H7181><s%> unto me <S%H6030><s%>, and hear me <S%H7300><s%>: I mourn in my complaint <S%H7879><s%>, and make a noise <S%H1949><s%>;

Because of the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%>, because <S%H6440><s%> of the oppression <S%H6125><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>: for they cast <S%H4131><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> upon me <S%H639><s%>, and in wrath they hate me <S%H7852><s%>.
My heart <S%H3820><s%> is severely pained <S%H2342><s%> inside <S%H7130><s%> me <S%H367><s%>: and the terrors of death <S%H4194><s%> are fallen upon me <S%H5307><s%>.
Fearfulness <S%H3374><s%> and trembling <S%H7461><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> upon me <S%H6427><s%>, and horror has overwhelmed me <S%H3680><s%>.
And I said <S%H559><s%>, Oh that <S%H5414><s%> I had wings <S%H83><s%> like a dove <S%H3123><s%>! for then would I fly away <S%H5774><s%>, and be at rest <S%H7931><s%>.
Behold <S%H5074><s%>, then would I wander far off <S%H7368><s%>, and remain <S%H3885><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
I would hasten <S%H2363><s%> my escape <S%H4655><s%> from the windy <S%H7307><s%> storm <S%H5584><s%> and whirlwind <S%H5591><s%>.

Destroy <S%H1104><s%>, O Lord <S%H136><s%>, and divide <S%H6385><s%> their tongues <S%H3956><s%>: for I have seen <S%H7200><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and strife <S%H7379><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%>.
Day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> they go about <S%H5437><s%> it upon the walls <S%H2346><s%> there <S%H205><s%>: mischief also and sorrow <S%H5999><s%> are in the middle of it <S%H7130><s%>.
Wickedness <S%H1942><s%> is in the middle <S%H7130><s%> there <S%H8496><s%>: deceit and guile <S%H4820><s%> depart <S%H4185><s%> not from her streets <S%H7339><s%>.

For it was not a enemy <S%H341><s%> that reproached <S%H2778><s%> me <S%H5375><s%>; then I could have borne it <S%H8130><s%>: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify <S%H1431><s%> himself against me <S%H5641><s%>; then I would have hid myself from him:
But it was you <S%H582><s%>, a man my equal <S%H6187><s%>, my guide <S%H441><s%>, and my acquaintance <S%H3045><s%>.
We took sweet <S%H4985><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>, and walked <S%H1980><s%> unto the house <S%H1004><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> in company <S%H7285><s%>.

Let death <S%H4194><s%> seize <S%H5377><s%> upon them <S%H3381><s%>, and let them go down quickly <S%H2416><s%> into hell <S%H7585><s%>: for wickedness <S%H7451><s%> is in their dwellings <S%H4033><s%>, and among them <S%H7130><s%>.
As for me <S%H7121><s%>, I will call upon God <S%H430><s%>; and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> shall save me <S%H3467><s%>.
Evening <S%H6153><s%>, and morning <S%H1242><s%>, and at noon <S%H6672><s%>, will I pray <S%H7878><s%>, and cry aloud <S%H1993><s%>: and he shall hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>.
He has delivered <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%> from the battle <S%H7128><s%> that was against me <S%H7227><s%>: for there were many with me.

God <S%H410><s%> shall hear <S%H8085><s%>, and afflict <S%H6030><s%> them <S%H3427><s%>, even he that stays of old <S%H6924><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>. Because they have no changes <S%H2487><s%>, therefore they fear <S%H3372><s%> not God <S%H430><s%>.
He has put forth <S%H7971><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> against such as be at peace <S%H7965><s%> with him <S%H2490><s%>: he has broken his covenant <S%H1285><s%>.

The words of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> were smoother <S%H2505><s%> than butter <S%H4260><s%>, but war <S%H7128><s%> was in his heart <S%H3820><s%>: his words <S%H1697><s%> were softer <S%H7401><s%> than oil <S%H8081><s%>, yet were they drawn swords <S%H6609><s%>.

Cast <S%H7993><s%> your burden <S%H3053><s%> upon the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and he shall sustain <S%H3557><s%> you <S%H5769><s%>: he shall never allow <S%H5414><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> to be moved <S%H4131><s%>.

But you <S%H430><s%>, O God, shall bring them down <S%H3381><s%> into the pit <S%H875><s%> of destruction <S%H7845><s%>: bloody <S%H1818><s%> and deceitful <S%H4820><s%> men <S%H582><s%> shall not live out half <S%H2673><s%> their days <S%H3117><s%>; but I will trust in you <S%H982><s%>.
